clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Esophageal and Tracheal Temperature in the Patients Using Breathing Circuit With Heated Wire Humidifier
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Esophageal and Tracheal Temperature in the Patients Using Breathing Circuit With Heated Wire Humidifier

brief_summary.textblock: When using a breathing circuit with heated wire humidifier, investigators will check if the temperature measured by the thermometer of the endotracheal tube is more than 0.25 degrees apart from the temperature measured by the esophageal thermometer. Through this, in the case of patients who need to use a breathing circuit with heated wire humidifier, investigators will find out whether it is appropriate to use an esophageal or endotracheal thermometer.

primary_outcome.description: Esophageal and tracheal temperature measurement in patients undergoing surgery that requires more than 2 hours of general anesthesia and the use of breathing circuit with heated wire humidifier

clinical_study.condition: The Patients Who Underwent General Anesthesia

intervention.description: When the patient enters the operating room, oxygen saturation, blood pressure, and electrocardiogram are monitored, and general anesthesia is induced using 1-2 mg/kg of 1% propofol. 0.8 mg/kg of rocuronium, a neuromuscular blocker, is injected intravenously, and a human endotracheal tube is intubated. A thermometer is attached to the inside of the double-layered endotracheal tube cuff, which measures the temperature in the trachea. After the endotracheal intubation is performed, the esophageal thermometer is inserted, and from this point, the temperature measured by the esophageal thermometer and the thermometer of the endotracheal tube are recorded. The temperature immediately after insertion of the esophageal thermometer is set as Tbaseline, and the temperature of the esophagus and trachea, the temperature of the operating room, and the temperature of breathing circuit with heated wire humidifier are recorded every 5 minutes from thereafter until the end of the operation.

study_pop.textblock: Among the patients undergoing surgery that requires more than 2 hours of general anesthesia and the use of a breathing circuit with heated wire humidifier

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- males and females between the ages of 20 and 60 and meet the criteria for classification I and II of the American Society of Anesthesiology
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a predisposition for bleeding
- Patients with a history of inability to insert an esophageal thermometer (esophageal varices, esophageal stenosis, esophageal malformation, and anatomical deformation after esophageal surgery)
- pregnant woman
